Content: I need a simple delphi project showing a data module and a data grid

Here's a simple Delphi project that demonstrates a DataModule with a TDataSource and TDBGrid. This example uses an in-memory dataset to show how the components work together.

```pascal
// Main form unit (MainForm.pas)
unit MainForm;

interface

uses
  Winapi.Windows, Winapi.Messages, System.SysUtils, System.Variants, 
  System.Classes, Vcl.Graphics, Vcl.Controls, Vcl.Forms, Vcl.Dialogs,
  Vcl.Grids, Vcl.DBGrids, Data.DB, Vcl.StdCtrls, Vcl.ExtCtrls;

type
  TForm1 = class(TForm)
    Panel1: TPanel;
    DBGrid1: TDBGrid;
    Button1: TButton;
    procedure Button1Click(Sender: TObject);
  private
    { Private declarations }
  public
    { Public declarations }
  end;

  TDataModule1 = class(TDataModule)
    DataSource1: TDataSource;
    Table1: TTable;
  private
    { Private declarations }
  public
    { Public declarations }
  end;

var
  Form1: TForm1;
  DataModule1: TDataModule1;

implementation

{$R *.dfm}

procedure TForm1.Button1Click(Sender: TObject);
begin
  // Add a new record to the dataset
  Table1.Append;
  Table1.FieldByName('Name').AsString := 'New Entry';
  Table1.FieldByName('Age').AsInteger := 25;
  Table1.Post;
end;

end.
```

```pascal
// Data module unit (DataModule1.pas)
unit DataModule1;

interface

uses
  System.SysUtils, System.Classes, Data.DB, Datasnap.DBClient;

type
  TDataModule1 = class(TDataModule)
    DataSource1: TDataSource;
    Table1: TTable;
  private
    { Private declarations }
  public
    { Public declarations }
  end;

var
  DataModule1: TDataModule1;

implementation

{%CLASSGROUP 'Vcl.Controls.TControl'}

{$R *.dfm}

end.
```

```pascal
// Main form DFM (MainForm.dfm)
object Form1: TForm1
  Left = 0
  Top = 0
  Caption = 'DataGrid Demo'
  ClientHeight = 300
  ClientWidth = 400
  Color = clBtnFace
  Font.Charset = DEFAULT_CHARSET
  Font.Color = clWindowText
  Font.Height = -11
  Font.Name = 'Tahoma'
  Font.Style = []
  OldCreateOrder = False
  PixelsPerInch = 96
  TextHeight = 13
  object Panel1: TPanel
    Left = 0
    Top = 0
    Width = 400
    Height = 265
    Align = alClient
    TabOrder = 0
    object DBGrid1: TDBGrid
      Left = 1
      Top = 1
      Width = 398
      Height = 263
      Align = alClient
      DataSource = DataModule1.DataSource1
      TabOrder = 0
      TitleFont.Charset = DEFAULT_CHARSET
      TitleFont.Color = clWindowText
      TitleFont.Height = -11
      TitleFont.Name = 'Tahoma'
      TitleFont.Style = []
    end
  end
  object Button1: TButton
    Left = 160
    Top = 271
    Width = 75
    Height = 25
    Caption = 'Add Record'
    TabOrder = 1
    OnClick = Button1Click
  end
end
```

```pascal
// Data module DFM (DataModule1.dfm)
object DataModule1: TDataModule1
  Left = 0
  Top = 0
  Height = 150
  Width = 215
  object DataSource1: TDataSource
    DataSet = Table1
    Left = 24
    Top = 40
  end
  object Table1: TTable
    Active = True
    FieldDefs = <
      item
        Name = 'Name'
        DataType = ftString
        Size = 50
      end
      item
        Name = 'Age'
        DataType = ftInteger
      end>
    IndexDefs = <>
    ObjectIndex = -1
    Options = [doCalculate, doAutoCalcFields]
    SessionName = 'Default'
    Left = 120
    Top = 40
    RecordCount = 3
    object Table1Name: TStringField
      FieldName = 'Name'
    end
    object Table1Age: TIntegerField
      FieldName = 'Age'
    end
  end
end
```

To use this project:

1. Create a new VCL Forms Application
2. Add a DataModule to the project (Project > Add New > Data Module)
3. Add the code above to the respective units
4. Run the application

Features demonstrated:
- TDataModule containing a TTable dataset with Name and Age fields
- TDataSource connecting the dataset to the grid
- TDBGrid displaying the data
- A button that adds new records to the dataset
- Basic data editing capabilities

The grid will show:
- Name (string field)
- Age (integer field)

When you click "Add Record", a new entry will be added to the grid. The dataset is in-memory and will be cleared when the application closes.

To customize:
- Add more fields to the Table1 field definitions
- Change the grid column widths
- Modify the data types
- Add more buttons for data operations
- Connect to a database instead of using an in-memory table

Note: This example uses TTable for simplicity. For database connections, you would typically use TQuery or TClientDataSet instead.
